intro: Helminthotheca echioides var. pratensis, commonly known as field hawksbeard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers arranged in a single head, which is characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, often with a hairy surface. The species is native to Europe and has been naturalized in parts of North America.
